gurmukhi: ਦੇਵ ਰਾੲਿ ਜੀਅ ਮੋ ਭਲ ਮਾਨਾ ॥ ਬਡਾ ਕਰਮੁ ਅਬ ਬਿਸਨ ਕਰਾਨਾ ॥
transliteration: Dev Raae Jia Mo Bhal Maanaa|| Badaa Karam(u) Ab Bisan Karaanaa||
translation: Indra, the king of gods, liked all this very much in his mind that Vishnu had done such a great thing for them.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਨੰਦ ਬਢਾ ਸੋਕੁ ਮਿਟ ਗਯੋ ॥ ਘਰਿ ਘਰਿ ਸਭਹੂੰ ਬਧਾਵਾ ਭਯੋ ॥੧੮॥
transliteration: Aanand Badhaa Sok(u) Mit Gado|| Ghar(i) Ghar(i) Sabh-hoon Badhaavaa Bhayo||18||
translation: All of them forsaking grief, were filled with joy and the songs of happiness were sung in every home.18.

gurmukhi: ਬਿਸਨ ਅੈਸ ੳੁਪਦੇਸ ਦੈ ਸਭ ਹੂੰ ਧਰਮ ਛੁਡਾੲਿ ॥ ਅਮਰਾਵਤਿ ਸੁਰ ਨਗਰ ਮੋ ਬਹੁਰਿ ਬਿਰਾਜਯੋ ਜਾੲਿ ॥੧੯॥
transliteration: Bisan Ais Oupdes Dai Sabh Hoon Dharam Chhudaae|| Amraavat(i) Sur Nagad Mo Bahur(i0 Biraajyo Jaae||19||
translation: Instructing in this way, Vishnu caused all to abandon the acions of Dharma and went back again to heavens.19.

gurmukhi: ਸ੍ਰਾਵਗੇਸ ਕੋ ਰੂਪ ਧਰ ਦੈਤ ਕੁਪੰਥ ਸਭ ਡਾਰ ॥
transliteration: Sraavges Ko Roop Dhar Diat Koupanth Sabh Daar||
translation: Assuming the status of supreme preceptor of Sharvakas and engrossing the demons on the wrong path,

gurmukhi: ਪੰਦ੍ਰਸਵੋਂ ਅਵਤਾਰ ੲਿਮ ਧਾਰਤ ਭਯੋ ਮੁਰਾਰ ॥੨੦॥
transliteration: Pandrasvon Avtaar Im Dhaarat Bhayo Muraar||20||
translation: Vishnu manifested himself ad the fifteenth incarnation in this way.20.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਤਿ ਸ੍ਰੀ ਬਚਿਤ੍ਰ ਨਾਟਕੇ ਪੰਦ੍ਰਸਵੋਂ ਅਰਹੰਤ ਅਵਤਾਰ ॥੧੫॥
transliteration: It(i) Sribachitra Naatake Pandrasvon Arhant Avtaar||15||
translation: End of the description of ARHANT, the fifteenth incarnation in BACHITTAR NATAK.15.
Now begins the description of the incarnation named King Manu:
Let Sri Bhagauti Ji (The Primal Lord) be helpful.

gurmukhi: ਸ੍ਰਾਵਗ ਮਤ ਸਭ ਹੀ ਜਨ ਲਾਗੇ ॥ ਧਰਮ ਕਰਮ ਸਭ ਹੀ ਤਜ ਭਾਗੇ ॥
transliteration: Sraavag Mat Sabh Hijan Laage||dharam Karam Sabh Hitaj Bhaage||
translation: All the people were absorbed in Shravak Religion (Jainism) and all abandoned the action of Dharma.

gurmukhi: ਤਯਾਗ ਦੲੀ ਸਭ ਹੂੰ ਹਰਿ ਸੇਵਾ ॥ ਕੋੲਿ ਨ ਮਾਨਤ ਭੇ ਗੁਰਦੇਵਾ ॥੧॥
transliteration: Tyaag Daisabhdhoondhar(i0 Sevaa|| Koe Na Maanat Bhe Gurdevaa||1||
translation: All of them forsook the service of the Lord and none worshipped the Supreme preceptor (the Immanent Lord).1.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਿ ਅਸਾਧਿ ਸਭੈ ਹੁਅੈ ਗੲੇ ॥ ਧਰਮ ਕਰਮ ਸਭ ਹੂੰ ਤਜ ਦੲੇ ॥
transliteration: Sadh(i) Asaadh(i) Sabhai Huai Gad|| Dharam Karam Sabh Hoon Taj Dae||
translation: The saints became devoid of saintliness and all abandoned the action of Dharma;
